``` -Using the CSS type selector for selecting the `div`, you can style it with white text and a dark blue background: - ```css div { color: white; @@ -57,6 +60,8 @@ div { } ``` +::: + What's new here is that the width is calculated dynamically. Notice how we are calling the `calc()` function and passing an expression as an argument. The expression has two operands with different units and one operator, the subtraction operator. Percentage is a relative unit. The value (`50%`) will be determined by the width of the parent container. Then, `20px` is subtracted from the value. The result of this expression will determine the width of the `div`.
